title: Tanzania records strong growth in fish exports
description:
DAR ES SALAAM: TANZANIA’S fisheries sector has posted strong export growth, highlighting renewed investment and rising momentum in the country’s blue economy drive.

This was announced by the Permanent Secretary in the Ministry of Livestock and Fisheries, Agnes Kisaka Meena, during the closing cerem...

title: Tanzania's fisheries export surge boosts blue economy momentum
description:
DAR ES SALAAM, Nov. 22 (Xinhua) -- Tanzania's fisheries sector has recorded a sharp increase in exports, signaling renewed investment and growing momentum in the country's blue economy, officials have said.

Speaking at the closing ceremony of World Fisheries Day in Dar es Salaam on Friday, Agnes Ki...

title: Tanzania bets on LNG ahead of deadline
description:
LINDI: IN a global race where capital is chasing shorter-cycle energy returns, Tanzania is sprinting to close a decade-long negotiation on its 42 billion US dollars Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) project led by Shell (NYSE: SHEL, LSE: SHEL) and Equinor (NYSE/Oslo: EQNR) at Lindi.

The government wants ...

title: BoT’s new monetary policy stabilizes the Tanzanian shilling
description:
DODOMA: TANZANIA’S new monetary policy, which uses the Central Bank interest rate, has begun to show significant achievements in the country’s economy, including the strengthening of the shilling and the maintenance of price stability.

Pendaeli Chamicha, the Assistant Manager for Economics and Stat...

title: Tanzania sees wheat, edible oil production as a solution to reliance on imports
description:
DAR ES SALAAM: THE Minister for Agriculture, Daniel Chongolo, has asked the Cereals and Other Produce Regulatory Authority (COPRA) to explore additional strategic areas to broaden the scope of results.

The minister gave the instructions today, November 25, 2025, while citing the example of wheat an...

title: Stability returns to Tanzania
description: Since gaining independence in 1961, Tanzania had, until October 2025, never struggled with any form of internal strife or violence. For over six decades, its common sense of national identity and lack of ethnic divides have marked it out in a region which is otherwise beset with violence and conflic...
